page.title: 13 TIMES PAST IN SOUTH-AYR
page.content: We wondered if Alloway had changed during a lifetime so we spoke to a lady of 86 who has lived here since 1911. { {DIFFERENCES}The school was very small: only 2 teachers, now 17 teachers. Pupils wrote on slates as paper was a luxury. No school uniform was worn. There were fewer houses. Church congregations were smaller. The church officer was also janitor, bell ringer, lamp lighter and grave digger. Trams ran in the streets. There was a strawberry field. People made their own entertainment. Belleisle Golf Course was ploughed up for crops during the 1914_18 war. { {SIMILARITIES} The old village is still the same. Burns' Cottage looks the same but has now many more visitors.
